sub_title: Public Policy | EU Affairs | Strategic Communications
summary:
Sarah Jane is a member of the Cybersecurity Advisors Network (CyAN) and an alumna of the Cyber Security for Business Leaders, University of Oxford Saïd Business School. Based in Amsterdam, she is the representative of the International Cybersecurity Forum - FIC in the Netherlands. 

Sarah Jane is a consultant in public affairs and strategic communications, with laser focus on tech-driven public-private partnerships (PPPs). She has dealt with Internet governance and cyber matters for most of the past decade, mainly on initiatives in the fight against the most aggravated forms of cybercrime, as well as accelerating cyber-resilience, facilitating dialogue and rapprochement between cybersecurity ecosystems, CISO/ CIO communities and on core issues, e.g. strategic autonomy, cyber resilience, the trusted cloud, threat detection / incident response and high-potential start-ups/ scale-ups.

 Sarah Jane adapted into English the White Paper “Child sexual abuse material and online terrorist propaganda | Tackling illegal content and ensuring staff welfare” (2020) coordinated by the French hotline Point de Contact and supported by the European Commission through the Safer Internet France consortium.
